concise_definition: n. 俱乐部, 棍棒, 钉锤; v. 用棍棒打

definitions.explanation_en: An organization of people with a common interest or purpose, often meeting regularly for social, recreational, or professional activities.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一群有共同兴趣或目标的人组成的组织，通常定期聚会进行社交、娱乐或专业活动。
definitions.example_en: She joined a book club to discuss novels with other literature enthusiasts.
definitions.example_cn: 她加入了一个读书俱乐部，与其他文学爱好者讨论小说。

definitions.explanation_en: A heavy, blunt instrument used as a weapon, typically made of wood or metal, designed to strike or crush.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种沉重、钝头的武器，通常由木头或金属制成，用于击打或砸碎。
definitions.example_en: The guard swung his club to disperse the crowd.
definitions.example_cn: 警卫挥动棍棒驱散了人群。

definitions.explanation_en: A playing card with the symbol of a clover leaf, one of the four suits in a standard deck.
definitions.explanation_cn: 扑克牌中的一种花色，图案为三叶草，是标准一副牌中的四种花色之一。
definitions.example_en: He drew the ace of clubs and smiled—he had a winning hand.
definitions.example_cn: 他抽到了梅花A，笑了起来——他有一手好牌。

definitions.explanation_en: To strike or hit someone or something repeatedly with a club or similar heavy object.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用棍棒或类似的重物反复击打某人或某物。
definitions.example_en: The protesters were clubbed by police officers during the demonstration.
definitions.example_cn: 示威者在游行中遭到警察用警棍殴打。

comparison.analysis: “Association” (协会) 更正式，常用于法律或专业语境，强调组织的结构和章程，如“Chamber of Commerce”；而 “club” 更偏向非正式、以兴趣或休闲为导向的团体，如“golf club”。
“Bat” (球棒) 通常指用于体育运动的轻型击打工具，如棒球棒或板球拍，设计精良且有特定规则；而 “club” 更泛指重型、原始的打击工具，也可用于暴力场景，语义更宽泛且更具攻击性。
“Guild” (行会) 是中世纪以来由手工业者或商人组成的传统职业组织，强调技艺传承和行业规范；而 “club” 不限于职业，更强调成员间的社交或娱乐联系，现代语境中几乎无行业管制含义。
